classes.name: Fighter
classes.description: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.

options.description: A martial weapon and a shield

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

choices.name: Archery
choices.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

choices.name: Defense
choices.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

choices.name: Dueling
choices.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

choices.name: Great Weapon Fighting
choices.description: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die.

choices.name: Protection
choices.description: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

choices.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
choices.description: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

features.name: Second Wind
features.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.

features.name: Action Surge
features.description: You can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Extra Attack (2)
features.description: You can attack three times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Extra Attack (3)
features.description: You can attack four times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Indomitable
features.description: You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll.

features.name: Indomitable (2 uses)
features.description: You can use Indomitable twice between long rests.

features.name: Indomitable (3 uses)
features.description: You can use Indomitable three times between long rests.

subclasses.name: Champion
subclasses.description: A Champion focuses on the development of martial prowess in a relentless pursuit of victory.

features.name: Improved Critical
features.description: Your attack rolls with weapons and Unarmed Strikes can score a Critical Hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

features.name: Remarkable Athlete
features.description: Advantage on Initiative rolls and Strength (Athletics) checks. After a Critical Hit, move up to half your Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Additional Fighting Style
features.description: You gain another Fighting Style feat of your choice.

features.name: Heroic Warrior
features.description: Give yourself Heroic Inspiration whenever you start your turn without it during combat.

features.name: Superior Critical
features.description: Your weapon and Unarmed Strike attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

features.name: Survivor
features.description: Advantage on Death Saving Throws (18-20 = 20). If Bloodied, regain 5 + CON modifier HP at start of your turn.

subclasses.name: Battle Master
subclasses.description: Battle Masters study the art of combat, using maneuvers to outsmart and outmaneuver their foes.

features.name: Combat Superiority
features.description: You learn 3 maneuvers fueled by 4 Superiority Dice (d8). Regain on Short/Long Rest. Gain more dice/maneuvers at 7, 10, and 15.

features.name: Student of War
features.description: Gain proficiency with one type of Artisan's Tools and one skill from the Fighter list.

features.name: Know Your Enemy
features.description: Bonus Action: discern Immunities, Resistances, or Vulnerabilities of a creature within 30ft. Once per Long Rest, or expend a Superiority Die to reuse.

features.name: Improved Combat Superiority
features.description: Your Superiority Die becomes a d10.

features.name: Relentless
features.description: Once per turn, use a maneuver by rolling 1d8 instead of expending a Superiority Die.

features.name: Ultimate Combat Superiority
features.description: Your Superiority Die becomes a d12.

subclasses.name: Eldritch Knight
subclasses.description: Eldritch Knights combine martial mastery with Wizard spells to augment their combat skills.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: Cast Wizard spells using Intelligence. Gain cantrips and prepared spells.

features.name: War Bond
features.description: Bond with up to 2 weapons. Can't be disarmed, and can summon one to your hand as a Bonus Action.

features.name: War Magic
features.description: Replace one attack with a Wizard cantrip (Action cast time) during an Attack action.

features.name: Eldritch Strike
features.description: Weapon hit imposes Disadvantage on the target's next saving throw against your spell before the end of your next turn.

features.name: Arcane Charge
features.description: Teleport up to 30ft when using Action Surge (before or after the extra action).

features.name: Improved War Magic
features.description: Replace two attacks with a Level 1 or 2 Wizard spell during an Attack action.

subclasses.name: Psi Warrior
subclasses.description: Psi Warriors harness psionic energy to infuse strikes, create barriers, and move objects.

features.name: Psionic Power
features.description: Harbor Psionic Energy Dice. Features: Protective Field (reduce damage), Psionic Strike (extra Force damage), Telekinetic Movement.

features.name: Telekinetic Adept
features.description: Psi-Powered Leap (Bonus Action Fly speed) and Telekinetic Thrust (force Prone or move 10ft on Psionic Strike).

features.name: Guarded Mind
features.description: Resistance to Psychic damage. Expend a die to end Charmed or Frightened conditions.

features.name: Bulwark of Force
features.description: Bonus Action: give Half Cover to yourself and allies (up to Int mod) within 30ft for 1 minute.

features.name: Telekinetic Master
features.description: Cast Telekinesis (Int) without slot. Attack as Bonus Action while maintaining Concentration.

keyDecisionPoints.decision: Fighting Style - defines your combat approach
ASI or Feat - improve abilities or gain new capabilities

classes.name: Cleric
classes.description: A priestly champion who wields divine magic in service of a higher power.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: As a conduit for divine power, you can cast cleric spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability.

features.name: Divine Domain
features.description: Choose one domain related to your deity. Your choice grants you domain spells and other features.

features.name: Channel Divinity
features.description: You gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects.

features.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead
features.description: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute.

features.name: Destroy Undead
features.description: When an undead fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead feature, the creature is instantly destroyed if its challenge rating is at or below a certain threshold.

features.name: Divine Intervention
features.description: You can call on your deity to intervene on your behalf when your need is great.

subclasses.name: Life Domain
subclasses.description: The Life domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy that sustains all life.

features.name: Life Domain Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: Aid, Bless, Cure Wounds, Lesser Restoration at level 3, etc.

features.name: Disciple of Life
features.description: When a spell you cast with a spell slot restores Hit Points, the creature regains additional HP equal to 2 plus the spell slot's level.

features.name: Preserve Life
features.description: As a Magic action, you expend Channel Divinity to heal bloodied creatures within 30 feet.

features.name: Blessed Healer
features.description: Healing spells you cast on others heal you as well.

features.name: Supreme Healing
features.description: When you restore Hit Points with a spell or Channel Divinity, use the highest number possible for each die.

subclasses.name: Light Domain
subclasses.description: The Light domain emphasizes the divine power to bring about blazing fire and revelation.

features.name: Light Domain Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: Burning Hands, Faerie Fire, Scorching Ray, See Invisibility at level 3, etc.

features.name: Radiance of the Dawn
features.description: As a Magic action, you expend Channel Divinity to emit a flash of light that dispels darkness and deals radiant damage.

features.name: Warding Flare
features.description: When a creature within 30 feet attacks, you can use a Reaction to impose Disadvantage.

features.name: Improved Warding Flare
features.description: You regain uses of Warding Flare on a Short Rest and grant temporary HP when using it.

features.name: Corona of Light
features.description: As a Magic action, you emit an aura of sunlight that imposes Disadvantage on saves against your fire/radiant effects.

subclasses.name: Trickery Domain
subclasses.description: The Trickery Domain offers magic of deception, illusion, and stealth.

features.name: Trickery Domain Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: Charm Person, Disguise Self, Invisibility, Pass without Trace at level 3, etc.

features.name: Blessing of the Trickster
features.description: As a Magic action, you grant Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to yourself or a willing creature.

features.name: Invoke Duplicity
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you expend Channel Divinity to create an illusion of yourself.

features.name: Trickster's Transposition
features.description: You can teleport and swap places with your illusion.

features.name: Improved Duplicity
features.description: Your illusion grants shared distraction and heals when it ends.

subclasses.name: War Domain
subclasses.description: Clerics of the War Domain excel in battle, inspiring others to fight the good fight.

features.name: War Domain Spells
features.description: You always have certain spells prepared: Guiding Bolt, Magic Weapon, Shield of Faith, Spiritual Weapon at level 3, etc.

features.name: War Priest
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can make one attack with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike.

features.name: Guided Strike
features.description: You can expend Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to an attack roll.

features.name: War God's Blessing
features.description: You can expend Channel Divinity to cast Shield of Faith or Spiritual Weapon without concentration.

features.name: Avatar of Battle
features.description: You gain Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

keyDecisionPoints.decision: Divine Domain - shapes your entire playstyle

classes.name: Rogue
classes.description: A scoundrel who uses stealth and trickery to overcome obstacles and enemies.

options.description: A shortbow and quiver of 20 arrows

features.name: Expertise
features.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with thieves' tools. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.description: You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. You don't need advantage if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it.

features.name: Thieves' Cant
features.description: You have learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation.

features.name: Cunning Action
features.description: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

features.name: Uncanny Dodge
features.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

features.name: Evasion
features.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed, and only half damage if you fail.

features.name: Reliable Talent
features.description: Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

features.name: Blindsense
features.description: If you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 10 feet of you.

features.name: Slippery Mind
features.description: You have acquired greater mental strength. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

features.name: Elusive
features.description: You are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated.

features.name: Stroke of Luck
features.description: You have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need to. If your attack misses a target within range, you can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20.

subclasses.name: Thief
subclasses.description: You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cutpurses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype.

features.name: Fast Hands
features.description: You can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock, or take the Use an Object action.

features.name: Second-Story Work
features.description: You gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs you extra movement. In addition, when you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.

features.name: Supreme Sneak
features.description: You have advantage on a Dexterity (Stealth) check if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

features.name: Use Magic Device
features.description: You have learned enough about the workings of magic that you can improvise the use of items even when they are not intended for you. You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

features.name: Thief's Reflexes
features.description: You can take two turns during the first round of any combat. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at your initiative minus 10.

teachingNotes.playstyle: Classic rogue focused on skills, agility, and utility

subclasses.name: Arcane Trickster
subclasses.description: You enhance your sneaking and agility with magic, learning illusions and enchantment spells.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You gain the ability to cast spells.

subclasses.name: Assassin
subclasses.description: You focus your training on the grim art of death.

features.name: Assassinate
features.description: You are at your deadliest when you get the drop on your enemies. You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in the combat yet.

subclasses.name: Soulknife
subclasses.description: You strike with minds rather than muscles, manifesting your power as blades of psychic energy.

features.name: Psychic Blades
features.description: You can manifest shimmering blades of psychic energy from your hands.

classes.name: Barbarian
classes.description: A fierce warrior who can enter a battle rage.

features.name: Rage
features.description: In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action.

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.description: While not wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + DEX modifier + CON modifier.

features.name: Reckless Attack
features.description: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation.

features.name: Danger Sense
features.description: You gain advantage on DEX saving throws against effects you can see.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice when you take the Attack action.

subclasses.name: Path of the Berserker
subclasses.description: Barbarians who walk the Path of the Berserker direct their Rage primarily toward violence.

features.name: Frenzy
features.description: If you use Reckless Attack while your Rage is active, you deal extra damage to the first target you hit on your turn with a Strength-based attack.

features.name: Mindless Rage
features.description: You have Immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions while your Rage is active.

features.name: Retaliation
features.description: When you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to make one melee attack against that creature.

features.name: Intimidating Presence
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can strike terror into others with your menacing presence and primal power.

subclasses.name: Path of the Wild Heart
subclasses.description: Barbarians who follow the Path of the Wild Heart view themselves as kin to animals.

features.name: Animal Speaker
features.description: You can cast the Beast Sense and Speak with Animals spells but only as Rituals.

features.name: Rage of the Wilds
features.description: Whenever you activate your Rage, you gain one of the following options: Bear, Eagle, or Wolf.

features.name: Aspect of the Wilds
features.description: You gain one of the following options: Owl, Panther, or Salmon.

features.name: Nature Speaker
features.description: You can cast the Commune with Nature spell but only as a Ritual.

features.name: Power of the Wilds
features.description: Whenever you activate your Rage, you gain one of the following options: Falcon, Lion, or Ram.

subclasses.name: Path of the World Tree
subclasses.description: Barbarians who follow the Path of the World Tree connect with the cosmic tree Yggdrasil through their Rage.

features.name: Vitality of the Tree
features.description: Your Rage taps into the life force of the World Tree, granting Temporary Hit Points.

features.name: Branches of the Tree
features.description: You can summon spectral branches to teleport creatures within 30 feet.

features.name: Battering Roots
features.description: Your reach is 10 feet greater with Heavy or Versatile Melee weapons.

features.name: Travel Along the Tree
features.description: You can teleport up to 60 feet (or 150 feet) through the World Tree.

subclasses.name: Path of the Zealot
subclasses.description: Barbarians who walk the Path of the Zealot receive boons from a god or pantheon.

features.name: Divine Fury
features.description: You can channel divine power into your strikes.

features.name: Warrior of the Gods
features.description: A divine entity helps ensure you can continue the fight, providing a healing pool.

features.name: Fanatical Focus
features.description: You can reroll a failed saving throw with a bonus while raging.

features.name: Zealous Presence
features.description: You unleash a battle cry that grants advantage to allies.

features.name: Rage of the Gods
features.description: You assume the form of a divine warrior, gaining flight and resistances.

classes.name: Bard
classes.description: An inspiring magician whose power echoes the music of creation.

features.name: Bardic Inspiration
features.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music.

features.name: Jack of All Trades
features.description: You can add half your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

features.name: Song of Rest
features.description: You can use soothing music or oration to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

subclasses.name: College of Lore
subclasses.description: Bards of the College of Lore know something about most things.

features.name: Bonus Proficiencies
features.description: You gain proficiency with three skills of your choice.

features.name: Cutting Words
features.description: You learn to use your wit to supernaturally distract, confuse, and otherwise sap the confidence and competence of others.

features.name: Magical Discoveries
features.description: You learn two spells from the Cleric, Druid, or Wizard spell list. These spells are always prepared.

features.name: Peerless Skill
features.description: When you fail an ability check or attack roll, you can add a Bardic Inspiration die to the roll. The die isn't expended on a failure.

subclasses.name: College of Dance
subclasses.description: You know that the multiverse dances to the rhythm of creation, and you use your movements to harness that rhythm.

features.name: Dazzling Footwork
features.description: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield, you gain advantages in Performance, Unarmored Defense, and Agile Strikes.

features.name: Inspiring Movement
features.description: As a Reaction, you can expend Bardic Inspiration to move yourself and an ally without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

features.name: Tandem Footwork
features.description: You can expend Bardic Inspiration to grant an initiative bonus to yourself and nearby allies.

features.name: Leading Evasion
features.description: You and nearby allies gain benefits to Dexterity saving throws, potentially taking no damage on a success.

subclasses.name: College of Glamour
subclasses.description: The College of Glamour is open to those who mastered their craft in the vibrant realm of the Feywild.

features.name: Beguiling Magic
features.description: You always have Charm Person and Mirror Image prepared. You can Charm or Frighten creatures after casting Enchantment/Illusion spells.

features.name: Mantle of Inspiration
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you can spend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to grant temporary HP and movement to allies.

features.name: Mantle of Majesty
features.description: You always have Command prepared. You can cast it as a Bonus Action for 1 minute.

features.name: Unbreakable Majesty
features.description: As a Bonus Action, you assume a majestic presence that can cause attacks against you to miss.

subclasses.name: College of Valor
subclasses.description: Bards of the College of Valor are daring skalds whose tales keep the memory of the great heroes of the past alive.

features.name: Combat Inspiration
features.description: Allies can use your Bardic Inspiration for Defense (AC bonus) or Offense (Damage bonus).

features.name: Martial Training
features.description: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons, Medium armor, and Shields. You can use weapons as a spellcasting focus.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice, or replace one attack with a cantrip.

features.name: Battle Magic
features.description: After casting a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a Bonus Action.

classes.name: Druid
classes.description: A priest of the Old Faith, wielding the powers of nature and adopting animal forms.

features.name: Druidic
features.description: You know Druidic, the secret language of druids.

features.name: Wild Shape
features.description: You can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before.

subclasses.name: Circle of the Land
subclasses.description: The Circle of the Land is made up of mystics and sages who safeguard ancient knowledge and rites.

features.name: Circle of the Land Spells
features.description: Whenever you finish a Long Rest, choose one type of land: arid, polar, temperate, or tropical. You have the spells listed for your Druid level and lower prepared.

features.name: Land's Aid
features.description: As a Magic action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape and choose a point within 60 feet. 10-foot-radius Sphere: creatures make CON save or take 2d6 Necrotic damage (half on success). One creature regains 2d6 HP.

features.name: Natural Recovery
features.description: Cast one level 1+ Circle Spell without a slot once per Long Rest. Also, recover spell slots on a Short Rest (combined level <= half druid level).

features.name: Nature's Ward
features.description: Immune to Poisoned condition. Resistance to a damage type based on your land choice: Arid (Fire), Polar (Cold), Temperate (Lightning), Tropical (Poison).

features.name: Nature's Sanctuary
features.description: As a Magic action, expend Wild Shape to create a 15-foot Cube of spectral trees within 120 feet (1 minute). Allies have Half Cover and your Nature's Ward resistance while inside.

subclasses.name: Circle of the Moon
subclasses.description: Druids of the Circle of the Moon are fierce guardians of the wilds and masters of Wild Shape.

features.name: Circle of the Moon Spells
features.description: Always have certain spells prepared (Cure Wounds, Moonbeam, etc.). You can cast them while in Wild Shape.

features.name: Circle Forms
features.description: Improved Wild Shape: Max CR = Level/3. AC = 13 + Wis modifier (if higher). Gain Temp HP = 3x Druid level.

features.name: Improved Circle Forms
features.description: In Wild Shape: Attacks can deal Radiant damage. Add Wisdom modifier to Constitution saving throws.

features.name: Moonlight Step
features.description: As a Bonus Action, teleport up to 30 feet. Advantage on next attack roll this turn. Uses = Wis modifier.

features.name: Lunar Form
features.description: Extra 2d10 Radiant damage once per turn in Wild Shape. Can teleport one willing creature with Moonlight Step.

subclasses.name: Circle of the Sea
subclasses.description: Druids of the Circle of the Sea draw on the tempestuous power of the oceans.

features.name: Circle of the Sea Spells
features.description: Always have certain spells prepared (Fog Cloud, Gust of Wind, Ray of Frost, Shatter, Thunderwave at Level 3, etc.).

features.name: Wrath of the Sea
features.description: As a Bonus Action, spend Wild Shape to manifest a 5-foot (10ft at lvl 6) Emanation for 10 minutes. As a Bonus Action, target takes Cold damage (Wis mod d6) and Large or smaller creatures are pushed 15ft.

features.name: Aquatic Affinity
features.description: Wrath of the Sea emanation size increases to 10 feet. Gain Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

features.name: Stormborn
features.description: While Wrath of the Sea is active: Gain Fly Speed. Resistance to Cold, Lightning, and Thunder damage.

features.name: Oceanic Gift
features.description: Manifest Wrath of the Sea around a willing creature within 60 feet. Spend two Wild Shape uses to manifest it around both yourself and the creature.

subclasses.name: Circle of the Stars
subclasses.description: The Circle of the Stars allows druids to draw on the power of starlight.

features.name: Star Map
features.description: Gain a star chart (spellcasting focus). Guidance and Guiding Bolt prepared. Cast Guiding Bolt without a slot (Wis mod times/Long Rest).

features.name: Starry Form
features.description: Bonus Action: spend Wild Shape to take a luminous form (10 mins). Choose Archer (Bonus Action ranged spell attack), Chalice (extra healing), or Dragon (better concentration/INT/WIS checks).

features.name: Cosmic Omen
features.description: After a Long Rest, roll a die. Even (Weal): reaction to add 1d6 to a d20 test. Odd (Woe): reaction to subtract 1d6 from a d20 test. Uses = Wis mod.

features.name: Twinkling Constellations
features.description: Starry Form improves: Archer/Chalice (2d8), Dragon (Fly speed 20ft, hover). Change constellation at start of turn.

features.name: Full of Stars
features.description: While in Starry Form, gain Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

keyDecisionPoints.decision: Druid Circle - defines your focus and power source
Prepared spells - daily adaptation to nature

classes.name: Monk
classes.description: A master of martial arts, harnessing the power of the body in pursuit of physical and spiritual perfection.

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.description: While not wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + DEX modifier + WIS modifier.

features.name: Martial Arts
features.description: Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons.

features.name: Ki
features.description: Your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki.

features.name: Flurry of Blows
features.description: You can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

features.name: Unarmored Movement
features.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

features.name: Deflect Missiles
features.description: You can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice when you take the Attack action.

features.name: Stunning Strike
features.description: You can spend 1 ki point to attempt to stun a creature you hit with a melee weapon attack.

subclasses.name: Way of the Open Hand
subclasses.description: Monks of the Way of the Open Hand are the ultimate masters of martial arts combat.

features.name: Open Hand Technique
features.description: You can manipulate your enemy's ki when you harness your own.

subclasses.name: Warrior of the Elements
subclasses.description: You channel the elemental power of the multiverse into your attacks.

features.name: Elemental Attunement
features.description: You can use your reaction to reduce acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage you take.

subclasses.name: Warrior of Mercy
subclasses.description: You manipulate the life force of others to bring aid to those in need or an end to your enemies.

features.name: Hand of Healing
features.description: You can touch a creature and spend 1 ki point to restore hit points.

subclasses.name: Warrior of Shadow
subclasses.description: You practice the arts of stealth and subterfuge, bending the shadows to your will.

features.name: Shadow Arts
features.description: You can use your ki to duplicate the effects of certain spells like Darkness or Silence.

classes.name: Paladin
classes.description: A holy warrior bound to a sacred oath.

features.name: Divine Sense
features.description: You can open your awareness to detect evil and good.

features.name: Lay on Hands
features.description: Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes after a long rest.

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

features.name: Divine Smite
features.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice when you take the Attack action.

features.name: Aura of Protection
features.description: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you must make a saving throw, the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclasses.name: Oath of Devotion
subclasses.description: The Oath of Devotion binds a paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order.

features.name: Channel Divinity: Sacred Weapon
features.description: You can imbue one weapon with positive energy, adding your Charisma modifier to attack rolls.

subclasses.name: Oath of the Ancients
subclasses.description: The Oath of the Ancients is as old as the race of elves and the rituals of the druids.

features.name: Channel Divinity: Nature's Wrath
features.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to restrain a creature with spectral vines.

subclasses.name: Oath of Glory
subclasses.description: Paladins who take the Oath of Glory believe they are destined to achieve greatness through deeds of heroism.

features.name: Channel Divinity: Peerless Athlete
features.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to augment your athleticism.

subclasses.name: Oath of Vengeance
subclasses.description: The Oath of Vengeance is a solemn commitment to punish those who have committed a grievous sin.

features.name: Channel Divinity: Abjure Enemy
features.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to frighten a creature.

classes.name: Ranger
classes.description: A warrior who combats threats on the edges of civilization.

features.name: Favored Enemy
features.description: You have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy.

features.name: Natural Explorer
features.description: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment.

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice when you take the Attack action.

subclasses.name: Hunter
subclasses.description: Emulating the Hunter archetype means accepting your place as a bulwark between civilization and the terrors of the wilderness.

features.name: Hunter's Prey
features.description: You gain one of the following features of your choice.

subclasses.name: Beast Master
subclasses.description: The Beast Master archetype embodies a friendship between the civilized races and the beasts of the world.

features.name: Primal Companion
features.description: You can call on the primal beast spirits of nature to fight alongside you.

subclasses.name: Fey Wanderer
subclasses.description: Fey Wanderer rangers guard the border between the Feywild and the Material Plane.

features.name: Dreadful Strikes
features.description: You can augment your weapon strikes with mind-scarring magic.

subclasses.name: Gloom Stalker
subclasses.description: Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places: deep under the earth, in gloomy alleyways, and wherever else light is unknown.

features.name: Dread Ambusher
features.description: You master the art of the ambush. You gain a bonus to initiative rolls and extra damage on your first turn.

classes.name: Sorcerer
classes.description: A spellcaster who draws on inherent magic from a gift or bloodline.

features.name: Sorcerous Origin
features.description: Choose a sorcerous origin, which describes the source of your innate magical power.

features.name: Font of Magic
features.description: You tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by sorcery points.

features.name: Metamagic
features.description: You gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs.

subclasses.name: Draconic Bloodline
subclasses.description: Your innate magic comes from draconic magic that was mingled with your blood or that of your ancestors.

features.name: Dragon Ancestor
features.description: You choose one type of dragon as your ancestor.

features.name: Draconic Resilience
features.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclasses.name: Aberrant Sorcery
subclasses.description: You harbor a psychic wind from the Far Realm or another plane of madness.

features.name: Psionic Spells
features.description: You learn additional spells that count as sorcerer spells for you.

subclasses.name: Clockwork Sorcery
subclasses.description: You have tapped into the cosmic force of order, the clockwork precision of Mechanus.

features.name: Restore Balance
features.description: You can use your reaction to neutralize advantage or disadvantage on a roll.

subclasses.name: Wild Magic Sorcery
subclasses.description: Your magic comes from the wild forces of chaos that underlie the order of creation.

features.name: Wild Magic Surge
features.description: Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic.

classes.name: Warlock
classes.description: A wielder of magic derived from a bargain with an extraplanar entity.

features.name: Otherworldly Patron
features.description: You have struck a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice.

features.name: Pact Magic
features.description: Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells.

features.name: Eldritch Invocations
features.description: In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations.

features.name: Pact Boon
features.description: Your otherworldly patron bestows a gift upon you.

subclasses.name: The Fiend
subclasses.description: You have made a pact with a fiend from the lower planes of existence.

features.name: Dark One's Blessing
features.description: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + your warlock level.

subclasses.name: Archfey Patron
subclasses.description: Your patron is a lord or lady of the fey, a creature of legend who holds secrets that were forgotten before the mortal races were born.

features.name: Fey Presence
features.description: You can cause each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC.

subclasses.name: Celestial Patron
subclasses.description: Your patron is a powerful being of the Upper Planes.

features.name: Healing Light
features.description: You have a pool of d6s that you spend to heal others.

subclasses.name: Great Old One Patron
subclasses.description: Your patron is a mysterious entity whose nature is utterly foreign to the fabric of reality.

features.name: Awakened Mind
features.description: You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you.

classes.name: Wizard
classes.description: A scholarly magic-user capable of manipulating the structures of reality.

features.name: Arcane Recovery
features.description: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook.

features.name: Arcane Tradition
features.description: You choose an arcane tradition, shaping your practice of magic.

features.name: Spell Mastery
features.description: You have achieved such mastery over certain spells that you can cast them at will.

features.name: Signature Spells
features.description: You gain mastery over two powerful spells and can cast them with little effort.

subclasses.name: School of Evocation
subclasses.description: You focus your study on magic that creates powerful elemental effects.

features.name: Evocation Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an evocation spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Sculpt Spells
features.description: You can create pockets of relative safety within the effects of your evocation spells.

subclasses.name: School of Abjuration
subclasses.description: The School of Abjuration emphasizes magic that blocks, banishes, or protects.

features.name: Arcane Ward
features.description: You can weave magic around yourself for protection.

subclasses.name: School of Divination
subclasses.description: The counsel of a diviner is sought by royalty and commoners alike, for all seek a clearer understanding of the past, present, and future.

features.name: Portent
features.description: Glimpses of the future begin to press in on your awareness.

subclasses.name: School of Illusion
subclasses.description: You focus your studies on magic that dazzles the senses, befuddles the mind, and tricks the wisest folk.

features.name: Improved Minor Illusion
features.description: You learn the Minor Illusion cantrip. If you already know this cantrip, you learn a different wizard cantrip of your choice.
